identity.name: EventOS - Broadcast Control
identity.vibe: Mission Control meets Concert Visuals. High contrast, precision, dark mode native.
principles: Fusion: Broadcast TV Graphics + Airport Flight Boards
Content is King: The 'Current Phase' is the hero. Everything else supports it.
Negative Space: Dense data needs breathing room. Use wide gaps between time slots.
Contrast: Neon accents against deep matte black.

typography.strategy: The 'Swiss Brutalist' - Radical weight contrast with Technical precision.

heading.usage: Phase Names, Section Titles, Massive Countdowns

rules: Background is NEVER pure black (#000000). Use Zinc-950 (#09090b).
Text is NEVER pure white (#ffffff). Use Zinc-50 (#fafafa) to reduce eye strain.
Status colors (Live/Next) must be NEON/VIBRANT to cut through the dark theme.
Use 'Scanlines' or subtle grid overlays for texture.

grid_system.viewer: Single Column Focus. Hero (Current) takes 40% height. List (Next) takes 60%.
grid_system.crew: The 'Tetris' Grid. Dashboard metrics top, scrolling schedule left, notes/details right.
grid_system.admin: The 'Control Room' Grid. Dense, data-heavy, drag-and-drop zones.

spacing.base: Generous. p-6 to p-8 for containers.

schedule_card.style: Flat, border-bottom only (Flight Board style). No shadows.
schedule_card.interaction: Highlight on hover. 'Live' item gets a glowing left border.

phase_indicator.style: Pill-shaped, solid color background, bold text.

buttons.style: Sharp edges or slightly rounded (sm). High contrast borders.

backgrounds.description: Abstract glowing squares - use with low opacity overlay

tech_stack_specifics.performance: Raspberry Pi 3 Optimization: Avoid heavy blurs (backdrop-filter) on large areas. Use solid semi-transparent backgrounds (bg-black/90) instead of glassmorphism if laggy.

universal_guidelines: Do not use 'Inter' for headings. Use 'Oswald'.
Do not use gradients for text.
Ensure all interactive elements have data-testid.
Dark mode is DEFAULT and MANDATORY for the viewer/crew interface.
